question: Which country houses "Viti Levu Island"?
explanation: Viti Levu Island is the largest island of Fiji, an island country located in the Melanesia sub-region of Oceania in the South Pacific Ocean. This island houses the capital city of Fiji, Suva, and inhabits the majority of Fiji's population. Mount Tomanivi, the highest peak of Fiji, is located on this island. Also, this island is the only known home of one of the world's largest insects, the Giant Fijian long-horned beetle.
